title: shidou_mariya
body:
The primary antagonist of [[Maria Holic]].

He is a [[crossdressing|cross-dresser]] who attends a girls-only Catholic school in order to win a competition against his twin sister, [[Shidou Shizu]], for chairmanship of the family-owned schools. He frequently mistreats the main character, [[Miyamae Kanako]], using her secret [[yuri|lesbianism]] and his popularity to pay her back for discovering his cross-dressing secret.

title: the_nerv_white_paper
body: [i]Neon Genesis Evangelion RPG: The NERV White Paper[/i] (新世紀エヴァンゲリオンRPG NERV白書, [i]Shin Seiki Evangelion RPG Hakusho[/i]) is a card-based tabletop role-playing game spinoff of [i][[Neon Genesis Evangelion]][/i], written by Mitsuhiro Nakazawa and released by Kadokawa Shoten on 20 April 1996. title: ankokuboshi_kurome
body:
The main antagonist and true mastermind behind all of the events in [[Shin Jigen Game Neptune VII|Megadimension Neptunia VII.]] 

[spoiler]This is the original [[Tennouboshi Uzume|Uzume Tennouboshi]], nicknamed Kurome Ankokuboshi by both the regular and [[Adult Neptune|older Neptune]]. She was the Console Patron Unit (CPU) of Planeptune before Uranus and [[Neptune (neptunia)|Neptune]]. However, she sealed herself away because she could not control her powers. Coming to hate Gamindustri, the source of her power shifted from Share Energy to Negative Energy. Becoming consumed by the Negative Energy, she desired to break free from her seal to have her revenge. Her remaining Share Energy eventually split from her and took on the form of another Uzume Tennouboshi.[/spoiler]

Technically, her true name is "[spoiler]Tennouboshi Uzume[/spoiler]" and "Ankokuboshi Kurome" is just a nickname that [[Adult Neptune]] came up with and the other characters also started using.

Voiced by: [spoiler][[Honda Mariko]] (Japanese), [[Erica Lindbeck]] (English)[/spoiler]

h4. See also

*[spoiler][[Tennouboshi Uzume]], Other version.

title: app_filter
body:
Filters applied to an image after it was created, using a different application. Typically applied through websites or smartphone apps.

They're usually recognizable because they appear in the exact same shape and form on different pictures by different artists; for example, post #6893693 and post #6893697.

Note that these only count as [[third-party edit]]s if done by someone other than the artist.

title: deutsches_ahnenerbe
body:
The [b]Ahnenerbe[/b] (German for "Ancestral Heritage") was a [[waffen-ss|Schutzstaffel]] pseudo-scientific organization in [[Nazi]] Germany between 1935 and 1945. It was established by [[heinrich luitpold himmler|Heinrich Himmler]] in July 1935 to promote racial doctrines.

This tag mainly refers to its emblem: A [[sword]] inside a knot, surrounded with [[runes|Runic text]] on the edges that spell out “DEUTSCHES AHNENERBE".
[tn]post #1193584 for example[/tn]

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "Ahnenerbe":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahnenerbe

title: shack
body:
A small shelter constructed from whatever materials at hand. In contrast to [[hut|huts]], which are made from natural materials, shacks are made from scavenged man-made materials such as construction waste and discarded consumer goods. They are commonly found in [[slums]] and other areas of low income and high population density.

h4.See also
* [[corrugated galvanized iron sheet]]
* [[poverty]]
* [[ruins]]
* [[shed]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

title: corrugated_galvanized_iron_sheet
body:
A lightweight construction material commonly used as roofing for buildings. Despite the name, it is usually made out of steel or tin.

Other names include corrugated iron, pailing (Caribbean English) and corrugated sheet metal (American English).

h4. See also

* [[Thatched roof]]
* [[Tile roof]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Corrugated galvanised iron":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corrugated_galvanised_iron

title: footwear_ribbon
body:
A [[ribbon]] used to secure [[shoes]] on the feet by wrapping around and being secured to the ankles or calves.

Most commonly seen on [[ballet slippers]].  Also seen on the shoes of [[Kanonno Grassvalley]] and [[Luca Truelywaath]].

Sometimes seen on the shoes of [[Kaname Madoka]]'s [[magical girl]] outfit, though it's usually hard to tell whether the bow around her ankle is part of a shoe ribbon, a separate ankle ribbon, or simply a circular ankle strap on her shoe.

h4. See also

title: folding_stock
body:
A [[gun|firearm]] buttstock that [b]can be folded[/b] while not in use, reducing the weapon's overall length for easier storage or transport. It usually utilizes a hinged attachment to the receiver.

It is a prominent feature of modern [[weapon|small arms]] design. Most folding stocks fold to the side, while few models fold to the top (e.g. [[SPAS-12]]) or bottom (e.g. [[MP40]]).

title: kaisa_taivaljarvi
body:
[[Original]] [[Ostwindprojekt]] and [[Seno Lepo]] character. A rifleman corporal in the [[Finnish Army]] and in charge of the recruits of the main unit, 3rd platoon, 3rd Jaeger Company. She is 26-years-old and is typically calm and friendly, making her popular among recruits. This attitude drops when skipping meals or when food is bad as she adopts the demeanour of a drill sergeant. She often refers to her platoon as 'her children' and is called 'mommy' by characters like [[vahala (ostwindprojekt)|Vahala]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] styled into a [[ponytail]]. Also has a [[large breasts|large]] [[breasts|bust size]].

title: krista_kaitanen
body:
[[Original]] [[Ostwindprojekt]] and [[Seno Lepo]] character. A signaller corporal in the [[Finnish Army]]. She is 20-years-old and is the fastest runner in the company. She is quiet and reserved, reflected in her appearance as she maintains a professional and clean presentation of herself and her uniform. Because of this attitude, she gets flustered easily.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] styled in a [[ponytail]] with [[hairclip|hairclips]] on each side to maintain a clean and consistent look.

title: ring_fit_adventure
body:
An [[exercising|exercising]] action/role-playing game for the [[Nintendo Switch]].

The game comes with two accessories: the [[Ring-Con]], a Pilates ring that the user holds and one [[Joy-Con]] slots into, and the Leg Strap, a [[thigh strap]] that holds the other Joy-Con.

The game's main mode is a turn-based role-playing game, where progress is based on performing physical activities using the Ring-Con and Leg Strap. Other modes include fitness routines and party games. 

The game is popular with [[virtual YouTuber]]s for the fan service it provides.

h4. Characters

* [[Ring Fit Trainee]]
* [[Ring (Ring Fit Adventure)|]]
* [[Dragaux]]

* [[Hubby (Ring Fit Adventure)|]]

* [[Abdonis]]

title: shinigami
body:
A Japanese death god, one who reaps souls.

After [[World War I]], the European image of [[Death_(entity)|]] found its way into Japan, and most modern depictions of shinigami are at least slightly influenced by European folklore. Unlike the European Death, shinigami are commonly depicted as a species of death spirits rather than a single personification of the concept of death.

h4. See also

* [[Death (entity)]]

title: v-proleague
body:
V-proleague (VPL) is a professional mahjong league organized by Vtubers. It provides a competitive platform for Vtubers to showcase their mahjong skills in online matches.
The league aims to offer high-level gameplay opportunities for players and engage fans with quality online mahjong content.
Matches are streamed with commentary, and the league features official VPL-certified players.

Official VPL website
https://vpl2023.com/

Pisces (the [[Fish]]es) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere, between [[Aquarius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Aries (constellation)|]] to the east. Its brightest star is Alpherg.

Pisces is a V-shaped constellation, part of which ends in an O-ring-like asterism called the "[i]Circlet[/i]":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/circlet.html.

title: leo_(constellation)
body:
Leo (the [[Lion]]) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere, between [[Cancer (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Virgo (constellation)|]] to the east. Its brightest star is Regulus, which is part of the "[i]Spring Triangle[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spring_Triangle.

Leo resembles a stick figure of an animal and can be easily recognized by its sickle-shaped head, called the "[i]Sickle[/i]":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/sickle.html asterism. A small constellation called [[Leo Minor (constellation)|]] (the smaller lion) lies just above it.

Cancer (the [[Crab]]) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere, between [[Gemini (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Leo (constellation)|]] to the east. It is the dimmest of the zodiacal constellations. Its brightest star is Tarf.

title: vane_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

Voiced by [[Eguchi Takuya]].

Vane seeks to gain new companions. With that desire in mind and purity in his heart, he serves as first officer in the Order of the White Dragons. Serving alongside his beloved comrades, Vane would do anything he can to protect his country.

A muscular man with [[green eyes]], [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[undercut]]. He wields a large [[halbred]] as his weapon.

title: florida_bikini
body:
A [[meme attire|memetic]] [[bikini]] designed by [[Ryusei Hashida]]. Originated from "a tweet from January 2024 involving him inviting other artists to draw it":https://twitter.com/ryuseihashida/status/1746017195878920603.

Despite the name, it is actually named after [[florida-chan_(ryusei_hashida)|Ryusei's]] [[Original|OC]], and has no connection to [[Florida (location)|the U.S. state of Florida]].

The "Florida bikini" is similar to a normal bikini, except that the top piece is made up of two "half bikinis" only held together by C-shaped wires.

title: thompson_submachine_gun
body:
The [b]Thompson[/b] is a .45 caliber American [[submachine gun]], invented by John Talifero Thompson in 1919. It was initially marketed to the law enforcement officers as "Thompson's anti-bandit gun", but eventually became widely associated with the [[mafia]]. The [[weapon]] earned various nicknames such as the "Tommy Gun," the "Trench Broom," the "Trench Sweeper," the "Chicago Piano," the "Chicago Typewriter," and the "Chopper." The [[gun|Thompson]] was adopted by the US Army during the [[World War II]], and remained in service until the Vietnam War.

This tag applies to all Thompson variants such as:
* !post #3628555: The original [b]M1921[/b] and [b]M1928 Thompson[/b]. Features a finned barrel, a charging handle knob, [[vertical foregrip]] with finger grooves, adjustable iron sights, and accepts [[drum magazine]]s. 
* !post #5103708: Pre-WWII [b]M1928A1 Thompson[/b] (with rectangular handguard).
* !post #2362155: [B]M1/M1A1 Thompson[/b]. WWII-era simplified design with rectangular handguard, lack of muzzle device, charging handle on the right, and accepts only stick [[magazine (weapon)|]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M3 submachine gun]]
* [[Thompson (Girls' Frontline)]]
h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "Thompson submachine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thompson_submachine_gun
other_names: シカゴタイプライター
トンプソン・サブマシンガン

title: drum_magazine
body:
A type of cylindrical-shaped [[weapon]] [[magazine_(weapon)|magazine]] which stores [[ammunition]] in a spiral layout ([[bullet]]s aligned with the barrel), typically resulting in much greater capacity as compared to standard box/stick magazines. Usually associated with automatic [[gun|firearms]] such as the iconic [[Thompson submachine gun]] and [[PPSh-41]].

See also [[dual drum magazine]], a paired variation often associated with the famous [[MG42]] [[machine gun]] and [[real life]] Beta C-Mag.

title: naval_mine
body:
A [b]naval mine[/b] is an [[explosive]] [[mine (weapon)|device]] placed in water to damage or destroy [[ship]]s or [[submarine]]s. Unlike depth charges, mines are deposited and left to wait until they are triggered by the approach of, or contact with, any [[watercraft|vessel]]. They often take shape of a spiked metal sphere.

title: mafia_kajita
body:
Mafia Kajita (real name: Kajita Ryuuki) is a freelance writer who has been involved in many game, anime, and manga projects. He is also noted for his distinct appearance - [[bald]] head, [[sunglasses]], [[mustache]], and [[leather jacket]]. Kajita is friends with many seiyuu, notably [[Sugita Tomokazu]] on whose [[tomokazu sugita no anigera deduuun|radio show]] he regularly appears as a guest, and [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] with whom he has a [[washaganatv|radio-style YouTube channel]].

SP Tanaka is an alternate personality of his.

He is co-creator of the [[Goho Mafia! Kajita-kun]] manga by providing its material.

title: vz._58
body:
The [b]vz. 58[/b] (or Sa vz. 58) is a 7.62×39mm [[assault rifle]] designed and manufactured in [[Czechoslovakia]] and accepted into service in the late 1950s as the [i]7,62 mm samopal vzor 58[/i] ("7.62mm submachine gun model 58").
While externally resembling the [[AK-47]], the vz. 58 a different design based on a short-stroke gas piston. It shares no parts with any [[Kalashnikov rifle]], including the [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. [tn](see post #6266531)[/tn]
h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]] 
* [[Skorpion vz. 61|Škorpion vz. 61]]

title: rising_sun_flag
body:
The symbol of the former [[Imperial Japanese Army]] and [[Imperial Japanese Navy|Navy]] and the current naval ensign of [[Japan]], still used in the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]]. It has a red sun with sixteen rays on a white field, with the sun being off-center to the left in the naval ensign version.

* !asset #20077384: Current flag of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.

Mostly confused as the Empire of Japan's state flag during the Meiji-era until end of World War II (Empire of Japan at the time use the same flag as today's Japan). Commonly viewed in other Asian countries (especially [[China]] and [[Korea]]) as a symbol of Japanese aggression and colonialism. Many Japanese, however, disagree with this view.

title: cricket-chan_(harumina_mau)
body:
[[original|Original character]] created by the artist [[Harumina Mau]].

She is one of the main characters in a comics saga which represents multiple [[arthropod girl|arthropod girls]].

She is a [[mini_person|tiny]] [[arthropod girl|cricket girl]], living free in the nature. Her appareance resembles to [[cockroach-chan_(harumina_mau)|cockroach-chan]], another character created by the same artist; due to this, the humans in the comics tend to confuse her as a cockroach, leading to mainly comical situations.

She has [[brown hair|brown]] [[very long hair]] with [[two side up|a pair]] of [[drill hair|drills]], [[antenna hair|antennas]], [[gradient eyes]], and [[fangs]] (Most of the time portrayed with [[skin fangs]]). Her attire consist in a [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[brown dress]] with [[frilled dress|frills]], a [[brown jacket|brown]] [[open jacket|open]] [[cropped jacket]] with a [[brown bow]], and a [[red brooch]]. Her footwear consists in a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[mary janes]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. The artist always portraits her as a [[chibi]].

title: kamen_america
body:
The main character of the [[Kamen America (comic)|Kamen America]] comic series and leader of the Kamen Corps. Her real name is Charlotte "Carly" Vanders. She was struck by parts of a space probe carrying chimeraton particles, giving her lightning powers and the ability to fly while transformed into her superhero form. An aspiring fashionista, Carly uses her powers to fight monsters as well as to promote her fashion brand.

Carly has [[blue eyes]] and long [[orange hair]] normally. Her hair becomes [[blonde_hair|blonde]] while transformed and she gains an [[ahoge]].

title: chinese_new_year
body:
A holiday celebrating the [[New Year]], also called "Spring Festival" (春节), in the traditional Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar, falling somewhere between January 21 and February 20. It is mainly celebrated in China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macao, in countries with significant Chinese populations, and in Chinatowns elsewhere. It is broadly called "Lunar New Year" because several other "new year" holidays such as Seollal (Korean New Year) and Tết (Vietnamese New Year) are also celebrated around the same time.

Before 1873, the Japanese had celebrated New Year's festivities around the same time as Chinese New Year. Since 1873, however, when Japan adopted the widely used Gregorian calendar, New Year's festivities are being held instead on January 1.

Many of the New year traditions are said to have originated from the legend of [[Nian (mythology)|]].

title: summoners_war
body:
Summoner Wars is a mobile video game developed by Plaid Hat Games and Playdek, and based on the 2009 board game of the same name. The iOS version was released on July 4, 2012. The Android version was released on May 15, 2014.

Both versions are now unavailable, having not been updated for upgraded versions of the mobile operating systems.

In 2021, the Summoner Wars: Second Edition board game was released, along with an accompanying online version.

title: world_endurance_championship
body:
A motorsport series sanctioned by [[federation internationale de l'automobile|FIA]] and founded in 2012 as a revival of the defunct [[World SportsCar Championship]]. As the name implies, the series is based around endurance racing, with events typically running between 6 to 8 hours.

The iconic 24 Hours of Le Mans, hosted at [[Circuit de la Sarthe]], has been a part of WEC's season since it's foundation.

WEC [[racecar]]s currently include the [[le mans prototype|Hypercar prototype class]], consisting of LMH and LMDh spec vehicles, and GT3 [[sports car]]s. LMP2 prototypes previously competed in the series, but have been dropped from the full season, now only appearing at Le Mans. LMP1 prototypes and GTE sports cars were also previously included in WEC, but have been replaced by the current Hypercar and GT3 rulesets.

title: vy1
body:
VY1 (codenamed "MIZKI") is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by the YAMAHA Corporation (Bplats, Inc.), and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

This VOCALOID is described as gender-less and has no official avatar, so instead there are fan interpretations. Fan designs are usually based on the boxart, which features two pink-themed [[kanzashi]] on VOCALOID2 and 3, a pink-themed [[folding fan]] on VOCALOID2 deluxe edition and a more colorful folding fan on VOCALOID4. All decorated with [[dogwood (flower)|hanamizuki]], which is also what the codename "MIZKI" is refers to.

h4. Other VY vocals
* [[VY2]]
* [[CYBER DIVA]]
* [[CYBER SONGMAN]]

h4. See also

* [[MIZKI (VOCADOL)]]

* "Its unique scoring display and SFXs for passing":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C4QYuQFO7Jk&t=438] and "failing":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C4QYuQFO7Jk&t=2185] are often parodied.
* Until 2020, the show's assistant girls were a rare opportunity to see the bunny suit on TV in Japan.

title: le_mans_prototype
body:
A type of [[racecar]], designed to be the top class of sports car racing. LMP cars are typically designed solely to compete in races, unlike other sports car classes that are based off road cars.

Currently, LMP2 is the only LMP class still used in the top level of racing, while LMP3 headlines lower series in the endurance racing ladder. The LMP1 class has since been replaced by Le Mans Daytona h (LMDh) and Le Mans Hypercar (LMH) spec vehicles, which compete in both the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]] and the [[World Endurance Championship]]. The former entry-level LMPC class was retired in 2017 amid growing costs to run.

While the term technically refers to the 4 LMP classes, for Danbooru purposes this tag represents all prototype-class race cars, including Group C, LMDh, LMH, Daytona Prototype (DP), and Daytona Prototype International (DPi).

h4. Examples
* !post #6706808: [[Oreca 07]], an LMP2 class prototype
* !post #6646649: [[Porsche 963]], an LMDh class prototype
* !post #7274596: [[Mazda 787B]], a Group C class prototype
* !post #6495824: [[Ferrari 499P]], an LMH class prototype

title: oktoberfest
body:
Oktoberfest, or Wiesn, is a 16-day festival held annually in Munich, Bavaria, Germany, running from late September to the first weekend in October. 

It is one of the most famous events in Germany and is the world's largest fair. The Oktoberfest is an important part of Bavarian culture, having been held since 1810. Other cities across the world also hold Oktoberfest celebrations, modeled after the Munich event.

h4. See Also

* [[dirndl]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oktoberfest

title: lotus_leaf
body:
A round leaf of the [i]Nelumbo[/i] family ([[lotus]]es).

Young lotus leaves float on the surface of the water but rise above it as they mature and have no notches unless damaged, which helps distinguish them from [[lily pad]]s, which float on the surface of the water and have a single notch in each leaf. 

Because of their hydrophobic surface, lotus leaves are often depicted with [[water drop]]s on them.

h4. See Also
* [[Lotus pod]]
* [[Lotus root]]
* [[water lily flower|Water lily]]

title: lily_pad
body:
A round leaf of the [i]Nymphaeaceae[/i] family ([[water lily flower|water lilies]]).

Lily pads float on the surface of the water and have a notch in each leaf, which helps distinguish them from [[lotus leaf|lotus leaves]], which rise above the surface of the water as they mature and do not have notches unless damaged.

h4. See Also
* [[Lily (flower)|]]
* [[Lotus]]

title: kyoto_animation
body:
Animation studio, nicknamed [b]KyoAni[/b] (京アニ). As its name suggests, it is primarily based in Kyoto Prefecture.

Use this tag to refer to the [[crossover]] of characters from anime produced by this studio or any work that directly references the studio.

On the morning of July 18, 2019, an arson attack was carried out at Kyoto Animation's first studio that resulted in 36 deaths and 33 injuries. Some posts will be in the 'In Memoriam' pool (pool #1318) for this reason.

title: ado_box
body:
A cage-like box in which [[Ado (utaite)|]] does live performances. In real life, it is lit such that the interior appears as only a [[silhouette]] to the audience, though in artwork [[Chando (ado)|]] is often fully visible in the box. The front of the box can also be used as a sort of display screen.

* !asset #20710499: First-person view from inside the box, during [[Shinzou (ado)|]]

[tn]The cage is required to prevent Ado from biting audience members.[/tn]

title: shijou_saikyou_no_deshi_ken'ichi
body:
(lit. "History's Strongest Disciple Ken'ichi" aka "Kenichi: The Mightiest Disciple" in the US)

A 2002 martial arts manga by Matsuena Shun, serialized in Shougakukan's [i]Weekly Shounen Sunday[/i]. Later adapted into a 2006 anime series and video game. 

The manga is essentially a remake of an earlier work by Matsuena, the 1999 [i]Tatakae! Ryouzanpaku Shijou Saikyou no Deshi [/i](戦え!梁山泊 史上最強の弟子, lit. Fight! Ryouzanpaku, History's Strongest Disciple), which was serialized in Shougakukan's [i]Shounen Sunday Super[/i].

h4. Characters

title: koshimizu_sachiko
body:
A character from [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]].

She is a very cute girl and takes great pride in this, to a seemingly [[narcissism|narcissistic]] degree. Witty and sarcastic, she has a sharp tongue and may come across as a sadist. She refers to herself as "boku", like [[Kikuchi Makoto]].

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the fourth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Akagi Miria]], [[Abe Nana]], [[Hino Akane (Idolmaster)|Hino Akane]], and [[Nitta Minami]]. She is voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

She is in the unit [[Kawaii Boku to 142's (idolmaster)|]] with [[Shirasaka Koume]] and [[Hoshi Syoko]], as well as [[KBYD (idolmaster)|]] with [[Kobayakawa Sae]] and [[Himekawa Yuki]] in the anime.

h4. External links

title: kawaminami_akira
body:
Kawaminami Akira is one of the main characters from the mystery novel (later adapted into a manga) [[Jukkakukan no Satsujin]].
She is usually called "Conan" by [[Shimada Kiyoshi]] because the kanji in her name can also be read "Konan".

In the novel, Kawaminami is male (his first name is Taka'aki).

title: shimada_kiyoshi
body:

In [[Jukkakukan no Satsujin]], he is a major character who investigates an unsolved crime with the help of [[Kawaminami Akira]]/Taka'aki.

title: jukkakukan_no_satsujin
body:
Jukkakukan no Satsujin ([i]The Decagon House Murders[/i]) is a mystery novel written by Ayatsuji Yukito (famous in the west for writing [[Another]]). It was originally published in 1987.

In 2019, it was adapted into a manga drawn by [[Kiyohara Hiro]] (who also drew the Another manga).

In 2024, the novel was adapted into a five-episode drama.

* The artist deliberately groups [b]all six[/b] of the members together.
** If only Okayu, Korone, Mio, and Subaru are shown, the work should be tagged [[SMOK (Hololive)|]] instead.
** Likewise, if Ayame and Subaru are absent, use [[hololive Gamers]] instead.

title: dongrang_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] antagonist. 

Named and based off the 20th century Korean playwright "Yoo Chijin":https://ko.wikipedia.org/wiki/유치진 (Alternatively known by their pen name of Dongrang) and his works (Most notably, his stageplay "The Cow":https://namu.wiki/w/소(희곡)).

[spoiler] A former member of the League of Nine Littérateurs, he betrayed the league in order to secure a position within K-Corps nest which directly led to collapse of the league. Before the collapse of the League of Nine Littérateurs, he was close friends with [[Yi Sang (project moon)|]] and [[Dongbaek (project moon)|]].

When utilizing his [[E.G.O (project moon)|]] Farmwatch, he wears a brown [[overcoat]], [[hanbok]] with a [[cowbell]], [[rice hat]] with 2 [[cow horns]] piercing the hat, [[brown gloves]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. He wields a plough-like scythe as a weapon.

title: drum_set
body:
A collection of [[drum]]s and other percussion instruments such as [[cymbals]] arranged to be played by a single person. Also called a [b]drum kit[/b] or a [b]trap set[/b].

The most basic set is composed of two tom drums set atop a bass drum, a floor tom drum, a snare drum, a crash cymbal and a pair of hi-hat cymbals on a stand. Depending on the music genre in which the set is to be used, other kinds of drums and percussion instruments can supplement the basic set.

title: metronome
body:
A device that beats rhythm by audible and/or visible means, to help a musician maintain constant speed while playing. The first metronomes were likely pendulum-based and powered by wind-up clock action. Later models were powered by electric motor (e.g. Franz box metronomes, fed by AC). Pendulum types are still made and sold. However, most modern, self-contained metronomes are now electronic and battery-powered, unaffected by gravity or angle, with options for separate, mutable audio-visual cues and rhythmic sub-divisions.

title: jagd_doga_gyunei_custom
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Char's Counterattack]] from 1988.

[b]MSN-03 Jagd Doga[/b]

An extensive modification of the [[Geara Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] for Newtype use. The two units produced were equipped with shields doubling as funnel pods on each arm and special armament for each of them - the unit piloted by Cyber-Newtype [[Gyunei Guss]] was painted a bluish green with yellow accents and possessed a more pronounced antenna on its head, and was furnished with a powerful beam assault rifle equipped with a grenade launcher.

[spoiler]Unlike Quess's Jagd Doga, Gyunei's does not survive -  after challenging [[Amuro Ray]]'s bluff, he is mercilessly crushed by the [[Nu Gundam]]'s Fin Funnels, believing they were just radiator fins.[/spoiler]

title: retributor_(warhammer_40k)
body: A homebrew Chapter of [[Adeptus Astartes]] developed by [[Syama Pedersen]] for his famous [[Astartes (web animation)|]] fan animation. They are descended from the [[Imperial Fists]] and specialize in small-scale, high-risk tactical operations rather than regularly engaging in larger setpiece battles like many other Chapters are portrayed as doing. To reflect their austere nature, they are clad in dark gray power armor and minimize the use of decorations such as capes for their officers.

title: modakawa_dress
body:

[quote]which char should i draw wearing this?[/quote]

The dress, popularized by online clothing retailer Modakawa, is listed on their site as the "Sexy Halter Hollow Out Backless Chain Fishtail Lingerie Dress.":[https://www.modakawa.com/products/sexy-halter-hollow-out-backless-chain-fishtail-lingerie-dress] It is a revealing dress featuring a {{halterneck}} held with {{o-ring}} and an abundance of straps with a {{hip vent}} on each side at the waist. A separate {{gold chain}} adorns it from top to bottom.
 
Many artists began drawing characters wearing the dress, simply referring to it as "the dress."

title: pointed_crown
body:

title: arched_crown
body:
A [[crown]] consisting of multiple metallic arches converging where the orb of the crown, or [i]monde[/i], would be at the very top. The arches may or may not be [[jeweled crown|lined with gems]]. The crown's [i]cross[/i], located atop the monde, would either be an actual cross to represent the Christian influence of monarchies, or can possess a different shape. The crown's [i]cap[/i] is lined with velvet that has a ermine base, although there are arched crowns with no cap present. Red velvet is typical of real-like royal crowns, and are frequently the basic depiction for arched crowns in artwork.

h4.See also

* [[pointed crown]]

title: shelter_(song)
body:
[i]Shelter[/i] is an animated music video created by musicians [[Porter Robinson]] and Madeon, in collaboration with [[A-1 Pictures]] and [[Crunchyroll]]. 

Shelter tells the story of Rin, a 17-year-old girl who lives her life inside of a futuristic simulation completely by herself in infinite, beautiful loneliness. Each day, Rin awakens in virtual reality and uses a tablet which controls the simulation to create a new, different, beautiful world for herself. Until one day, everything changes, and Rin comes to learn the true origins behind her life inside a simulation.

title: owata-ko
body:
The nickname of a player character in a "'Let's Play' video series" uploaded on [[NicoNico]] called "Let's Play [[Fallout 3]] PC Edition with a Little Girl, Owata-style". She is a [[blonde hair]]ed girl with [[twintails]] and she wears a variety of clothes that are not at all suited for combat.

オワタ式 ([i]owata-shiki[/i], owata-style) in Japanese game slang carries the same meaning as "sudden death-style" and refers to a style of play in which "MODs":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mod_%28video_gaming%29 and hidden commands are used to fix the player character's hit points at "1". "Owata" comes from "[i][[\(^o^)/|Jinsei Owata]][/i]".

There are several unique points in this "sexy" play video made by "JAX.":http://www.nicovideo.jp/user/560733 

* A MOD is used to turn "Vault101のアイツ (Vault 101 [i]no Aitsu[/i], Dat Dude from Vault 101)" (a nickname for the "Lone Wanderer":http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Lone_Wanderer in Japan) into a little girl. (Instructions for installing the MOD are explained in "the video creator's blog.":http://owatakogaippai.blog117.fc2.com/ )
* A MOD is installed for modifying attack power. The attack power is about three times that of normal.
* A MOD is used to increase a portion of the number of enemies by up to five times.
* The gore setting is always OFF.

This video series ended on "Part.25":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm10508206 while being well received. The total number of deaths was 380 times.

In this video, there was "a scene":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm9784985 where Owata-ko was saved from danger by the "Mysterious Stranger":http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Mysterious_Stranger called forth by her "perk.":http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Perk Judging from the stranger's dubious appearance, viewers of the series posted joke comments saying "that is definitely JAX's personal avatar". Also, near "the close of the game,":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm10106865 her little sister appears as a "companion":http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Companion and JAX simply called her [[Owata-ko 2]].

After that, he created a sequel titled "Let's Play [[Fallout: New Vegas]] PC Edition, Owata-style" that was concluded on April 28, 2011. The main character of this video was a girl with [[silver hair]] called [[Owata-ko 3]] but, unfortunately, she ended up being erased when the game's saved data was lost in "Part.6.":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm12786814 From there on, he returned to the starting point and re-introduced the original Owata-ko.

h4. See also

* [[Owata-ko 3]]
* [[Fallout 3]]
* [[Fallout: New Vegas]]

h4. External links

* "Nico Nico Douga: Let's Play Fallout 3 PC Edition with a Little Girl, Owata-style":http://www.nicovideo.jp/mylist/15911505 
* "Nico Nico Douga: Let's Play Fallout: New Vegas PC Edition, Owata-style":http://www.nicovideo.jp/mylist/22029672

title: hanma_yujiro
body:
The primary antagonist/anti-hero from [[Grappler Baki]].

Dubbed "The Strongest Creature on Earth", Yujiro is an incredibly strong and powerful man with "perfect gene" of the Hanma bloodline, capable of taking on a whole army by his own. He has "defeated" the government around the world and subdued them, thus allows him to do whatever he wished with little to no consequence. He is obsessed with having a "perfect" successor of his bloodline, so he decided to inseminate several women around the world for his heir to be his "worthy" opponent. [[Hanma Baki]] is one of his offspring.

Notorious for his over-the-top showmanship in which he believes his unrivalled strength can solve anything, even brute forcing though an otherwise trivial matters to prove his point.

h4. See also
* [[Demon back (baki)|]]

title: corrupted_mynah_(signalis)
body:
[[Mynah (Signalis)|Mynahs]] in their [[Zombie|corrupted state]]. These are the most dangerous variety of enemy encountered in [[Signalis]], and are most notably used as the first boss encounter in the game.

h6. Appearance
Corrupted Mynahs are the least diverged from their non-corrupted counterparts, only bearing a covering of [[blood|oxidant fluid]] [[blood on armor|on their armor]], particularly around the [[blood on hands|hands]], arms, and [[blood on chest|chest]]. Corrupted Mynahs typically have their [[face shield|face shields]] closed most of the time, but will occasionally open it in order to [[vomiting blood|release]] a flow of oxidant fluid and [[worm|worms]] from the cavity containing their face. Interestingly, according to the boss intro cutscene, corrupted Mynahs still have their faces intact, unlike every other corrupted replika seen in game.

title: list_of_genshin_impact_tags
body:
A list of [b]currently in use[/b] tags related to [[Genshin Impact]].
For characters, see [[list of genshin impact characters]].

h4. Items

h6. Items seen on characters

* [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] - Gem that matches one's element and is used to summon elemental power
* [[Gnosis (genshin impact)|]] - An item held by an Archon [tn]A god of a specific element and region[/tn] that acts as their vision
* [[Delusion (genshin impact)|]] - Artificial vision made by the Fatui

h6. Gacha currency

* [[Primogem]] - The standard gacha currency. 160 of these can be exchanged for one Fate
* [[Intertwined Fate]] - A star-like item that can be used for pulling in the limited gacha once, has a pink-blue gradient
* [[Acquaint Fate]] - Can only be used in the permanent banner, colored in blue
* [[Stella Fortuna]] - The item recieved once you pull a duplicate character, can be used to enhance said character
* [[Genesis Crystal]] - Premium currency only obtained through in-game purchases 

h6. Inventory items

* [[Artifact (genshin impact)|]] - Character equipment. Can have a variety of appearances depending on its type.
* [[Cloud Retainer Damasked Device (genshin impact)|]] - A paper bird companion given as a gift to the player from the [[Cloud Retainer (genshin impact)|]].
* [[Crimson Agate (genshin impact)|]] - A red crystal found in Dragonspine. Used at the Frostbearing Tree.
* [[Crown of Insight]] - A crown with a triquetra shape. Used to level up a character's talents to their final stage.
* [[Handguard (genshin impact)|]] - A handguard dropped by [[Nobushi (genshin impact)|]] and [[Kairagi (genshin impact)|]].
* [[Itty Bitty Octobaby (genshin impact)|]] - A tiny octopus companion.
* [[Mist Flower Corolla]] - A flower bud from the [[Mist Flower]].
* [[Mora (genshin impact)|]] - Genshin's equivalent to "gold" or "coins". Has a triquetra shape printed on it.
* [[Oculus (genshin impact)|]] - Found in the open world. Used at Statues of the Seven.
* [[Serenitea Pot (genshin impact)|]] - A teapot gadget which grants access to the housing mechanic.
* [[Shiki Koshou]] - A shikigami companion given as a gift to the player from [[Shiki Taishou]].
* [[Waverider (genshin impact)|]] - A boat.
* [[Wind Glider]] - Artificial wings used to glide.

h6. Local specialties and flora

* [[Ajilenakh Nut (genshin impact)|]] - A green fruit found on palm trees in Sumeru
* [[Amakumo Fruit]] - A purple fruit found in Inazuma

title: pm-63_rak
body:
The [b]PM-63 RAK[/b] ([i]Ręczny Automat Komandosów[/i], "commandos' hand-held automatic") is a Polish open-bolt 9×18mm Makarov [b][[submachine gun]][/b], designed in 1950s. The [[weapon]] was accepted into service with the People's Army of Poland and police in 1965 as the [i]9 mm pistolet maszynowy wz. 1963[/i] ("9 mm submachine gun model 1963") It has handgun-like ergonomics, reciprocating slide instead of internal bolt, an under[[folding stock]] and a foldable [[vertical foregrip]].

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[PM-84 Glauberyt]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: FB PM-63":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FB_PM-63

title: miclone
body:
A term from the [[MACROSS]] [[science fiction]] anime series, first introduced in [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|the original TV show from 1982]]. 

[b]Miclone[/b] is an extraterrestrial term used to describe normal sized [[Zentradi]] humanoid aliens. Miclones are very similar to humans, despite some of them having unique hair and skin colors (purple, blue, green, etc.) as well as [[pointy ears]].

h4. See also

* [[Maclone]]

title: micro_uzi
body:
An Israeli [b]machine pistol[/b], the smallest variant of the [[Uzi]] [[submachine gun]]s. It is smaller, lacks a forearm, and has shorter barrel length (117 mm) compared to the [[Mini Uzi]]. Introduced in 1986, it has very high cyclic fire rate of 1200-1500 rounds per minute. Commonly available in 9×19mm Parabellum.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Micro Uzi (Girls' Frontline)]]

body:
Superheavy soviet tank of [[Command and Conquer: Red Alert 3|Red Alert 3]], unlike its [[apocalypse tank (red alert 2)|counterpart]] in the previous game, this unit does not have the complimentary missiles. Instead, it is equipped with a magnetic harpoon, which attach and drag other vehicles to be crushed under its treads.


In other Modifications of the said game, Apocalypse retains those missiles combined with the magnetic harpoon for additional fear.

title: dear_sister_(meme)
body:
“Dear Sister” Parodies, sometimes referred to as "MMM Whatcha Say," are a series of YouTube videos that overdramatize a murder scene from a TV show or film by using slow-motion effect and Imogen Heap's 2005 folktronica pop song “Hide and Seek.” The meme was inspired by an episode of Saturday Night Live Digital Short titled “The Shooting,” which in itself is a parody of the climactic scene from the season two finale of the American teen drama TV series The OC.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme - Dear Sister Parodies / 'Mmm Whatcha' Say' ":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dear-sister-parodies-mmm-whatcha-say]
* "Youtube - TheLonelyIsland - The Shooting AKA Dear Sister":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vmd1qMN5Yo0] (the original skit being parodied)

title: japanese_crested_ibis_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The [[crested_ibis|Japanese Crested Ibis]] or Toki ([i]Nipponia nippon[/i]) is a large bird with a mostly white plumage, a bare head, showing red skin and a crest of white feathers on the nape. The japanese name for this bird ("Toki") is also used to refer to the Ibis group as a whole.

Crested Ibis (the Friend) has long, swept back white hair (resembling the bird's crest) which turns red at her sidelocks and [[head wings]], with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears a white jacket with red [[feather-trimmed sleeves]], a red [[pleated skirt]], and red pantyhose. Her eyes are yellow and she wears red gloves.
As her species were bought back from the brink of extinction (and were thought for some time as being extinct), she exibits [[empty_eyes|the lack of shine on the eyes]] usually reserved to extinct species.

She is best described as a terrible singer who likes to sing nonetheless. In the anime, she typically sings about where are her friends (her infamous "WATASHI WA TOOOKIIII" song) with a shrill voice that can stun most Friends (as poor [[Serval (kemono_friends)|]] can attest). A serving of [[Alpaca Suri (kemono_friends)|]]'s tea improves her voice to a certain extent (she can't stun anyone by singing).

She is often associated with another [[Toki (hokuto_no_ken)|]] (whom is also at the brink of death).

title: tarte_tatin
body:
A [[tart (food)|]] in which the fruit (usually [[apple]]s) is caramelized in butter and sugar before it's baked. Named after the Tatin sisters who invented it and served it in their hotel as its signature dish. It originated in France but has spread to other countries over the years.

title: deltarune
body:
[i]Deltarune[/i] is a game by [i][[Undertale]][/i] creator [[Toby Fox]] that was revealed as an unannounced surprise on October 31, 2018, with its first chapter released on that day and the second on September 17, 2021, each for free. It is planned to have several chapters.

While the game does feature appearances of characters from Undertale in similar roles, Toby Fox has stated that Deltarune has no connections with Undertale's story and is a separate continuity.
